decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the help of Amulet of Vigor and various land cards in order to bring out Primeval Titan as soon as possible. Once Primeval Titan is on the battlefield, the goal is to search for specific lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and The One Ring to further accelerate mana production and provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Unholy Heat. The deck also utilizes cards like Expressive Iteration and Consider to filter through the deck quickly and find key cards. Murktide Regent serves as a powerful threat in the mid to late game, while Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

The deck focuses on quickly cascading into powerful spells such as Crashing Footfalls and Leyline Binding, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats. It utilizes the Cascade mechanic to maintain pressure and control the board while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the cascade strategy and ensure consistency in casting spells. The goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent, seizing victory through a proactive and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder to quickly bring out lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and trigger its ability to deal damage. By controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and utilizing Wrenn and Six for card advantage, the deck aims to set up for a game-ending Scapeshift to combo with Valakut and deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also features creative choices like The One Ring and Pick Your Poison to provide additional utility and options in different gameplay situations.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creature cards to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It includes cards that allow for protection and control over the battlefield, as well as a companion creature that provides additional synergy and benefits. The main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells, while maintaining board control with disruptive cards and countermagic. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply constant pressure and tempo to secure a victory in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on maximizing damage output and aggression by utilizing a mix of different colored mana sources. The key strategy revolves around casting efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to finish off opponents quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth and consistent access to all colors needed for optimal aggression.

This deck seeks to overrun opponents with aggressive creatures, utilizing the Hardened Scales enchantment to boost +1/+1 counters. The creatures in the deck synergize well with the Scales, allowing for quick and powerful attacks. Supporting cards such as Urza's Saga and Walking Ballista provide additional value and threats on the board. The deck also includes some protection and disruption elements, such as Pithing Needle and Welding Jar, to ensure the strategy goes smoothly. Overall, this deck aims to quickly build a formidable board presence and overwhelm opponents before they can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push, while also utilizing disruption through cards like Dauthi Voidwalker. The deck also has some graveyard recursion and synergies with cards like Undying Evil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The inclusion of cards like Not Dead After All and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker further enhances the aggro strategy of the deck.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan with counter magic and disruptive creatures like Grief and Faerie Macabre. The deck uses cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Architects of Will to quickly dump creatures into the graveyard, and utilizes cards like Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent to cascade into Living End. The deck aims to create a big board presence and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on casting powerful spells with Cascade abilities to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing cards like Scion of Draco and Leyline of the Guildpact, it aims to control the battlefield while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy. With the combination of Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent, the deck can consistently cascade into impactful spells and creatures. The inclusion of Force of Negation provides additional protection against opposing spells, ensuring the deck can stay ahead in the game. Overall, the deck aims to cascade into victory by efficiently utilizing its spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a fast-paced aggressive strategy using low-cost and efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent while maintaining card advantage with cantrips like Preordain and Expressive Iteration. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional ramp and versatility. Overall, the deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and close out the match before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent. It aims to control the game through counterspells and removal while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco. The mana base is designed to support this strategy efficiently, allowing for consistent play of spells and creatures while maintaining flexibility. Overall, the deck prioritizes tempo and aggression to swiftly defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and creature removal. The deck includes powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure and close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Not Dead After All to disrupt the opponent's hand and keep them on the back foot. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain control of the board throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook to fuel its aggro strategy, utilizing cards like Ovalchase Daredevil and Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes graveyard recursion with Goryo's Vengeance and Traverse the Ulvenwald to bring back powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck incorporates a mix of control elements with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Pithing Needle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to quickly ramp up and put pressure on the opponent, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver its opponents in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and utilizing powerful enchantments like The One Ring. The deck includes a variety of control spells like Counterspell, Solitude, and Subtlety, along with card draw and filtering effects from cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to dominate the board with control elements and eventually win the game by out-valuing the opponent with card advantage and powerful enchantments.

This deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures, utilizing Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to sacrifice and manipulate creatures for value. Chord of Calling helps search for specific creatures, while Agatha's Soul Cauldron provides an alternate win condition. Grist, the Hunger Tide and Delighted Halfling generate tokens and provide a sacrifice outlet. The deck aims to control the board with versatile creatures like Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while utilizing Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key spells. The combo potential is high with various sacrifice and recursion effects to overwhelm opponents.
